Name: Contract Selection, Confidentiality
Title: A Local Law to amend the Charter of the City of New York in relation to imposing a confidentiality requirement on any person who participates in the selection of a contractor on behalf of a city agency.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section one.   Section 311 of chapter 13 of the charter of the city of New York is hereby amended by adding a new subdivision g to read as follows:
	g.	Prohibited conduct.  1.  No person who participates in the selection of a contractor on behalf of a city agency and who is no a public servant or regular employee as defined by chapter sixty-eight of the charter shall, during his or her service for such agency or after leaving said service, disclose any confidential information concerning the property, affairs or government of the city which is obtained as a result of the official duties of such person, and which is not otherwise available to the public, or use any such information to advance any direct or indirect financial or other private interest of such person or of any other person or firm associated with him or her; provided, however, that nothing contained herein shall prohibit any person from disclosing any information concerning conduct which he or she knows or reasonably believes to involve waste inefficiency, corruption, criminal activity or conflict of interest.  As used herein, a person or firm "associated" with an "interest" shall be defined as provided in chapter sixty-eight of the charter.
	2.	Penalties.  Any person who violates this subdivision shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and, upon conviction thereof, shall be forever disqualified from being elected, appointed or employed in the service of the city.
	ï¿½2.	This local law shall take effect immediately.
